Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer
Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant April Catina Shamble was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Clerks Note to Court re: Restitution surcharge
Criminal Case Settlement
Huber Law / Work Release Notification

Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV

Case called at 11:08am [mo]
Defendant April Catina Shamble in court with attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

ADA Hall submits a victim impact statement
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2, 3, 4, and 5

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:

--to serve 3 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on  7/18 /16
--the Court does authorize transfer of this sentence to Dane Co., so long as it is served as it would be in Jefferson County, that is without electronic monitoring

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per agent
--absolute sobriety (no alcohol, no controlled substances without valid prescription, take all prescription drugs as prescribed)
--mental health assessment per agent
--to undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent (to occur after sober lifestyle has been accomplished)
--to pay statutory costs 

--to pay restitution in the amount of $939.53 to EMC Insurance Company to be converted to civil judgment 


Days credit for time already served:  1  day
recess: 11:49am
JA notified defense counsel of Defendant's returned mail on 4/29/16
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 6, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Reserve Judge Davis presiding for Branch IV:  
case called at 8:41am. 
Defendant April Catina Shamble in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Ms. Shamble waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Attorney Svehlek requests that the case be scheduled for Plea & Sentencing hearing. 
recess 8:45am.


NEXT:   Plea & Sentencing hearing on 5/6/16 at 11:00am
Letter from Attorney Svehlek advising that the 3/11/16 hearing may turn into a plea and sentencing. Attached are defendant's written allocation and letters from Hope Haven and North Bay Lodge.

Case called at 1:32 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant April Catina Shamble appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint, appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient

Atty Hagemann informs the Court that Miss Shamble is eligible for SPD Representation
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $2500 signature bond, with conditions:
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
-No acts or threats of violence
-No contact with Melissa Schultz
(*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
Recess: 1:37 pm
